docs.title: Xignda(Eric) Bao
docs.text: Full-time Software Engineer, Stellar Services, NY, USA, 2023.6--Now Research Assistant, NYU High-Speed Networking Lab, NY, USA, 2022.9-- Now M.S. in Computer Engineering, New York University, NY, USA, 2021.9--2023.5

docs.title: Biography
docs.text:
Hello! My name is Xingda, or you can call me Eric.

Currently, I am a full-time Software Engineer at Stellar Services, a Tech company located in New York. At the same time, I am still a part-time research assistant at NYU High-Speed Networking Lab after my graduation.

I obtained my M.S. degree in Computer Engineering from New York University, advised by Prof. H. Jonathan Chao, in May 2023. I received my B.E. degree in computer science and technology from Nanjing University of Post and Telecommunication, advised by Prof. Yin Lu, in June 2021.

docs.title: Research Proposal
docs.text:
My research instersts incloud Computer Networking, High-Speed Networking, SD-WAN, SRv6, Data Center, Cloud Computing, Blockchain Technology, and IoT.

Recently, my research is Traffic Engineering in SD-WAN: Under the background of Software-define wide area network(SD-WAN) and Traffic Engineering(TE), with the Simple Two-way Active Measurement Protocol (STAMP), D-ITG (distributed Internet traffic generator) and Virtual Extensible LAN (VXLAN), we utilize active network probing flow to monitor network quality(like RTT and packet loss rate) in different underlying path in public internet and let application data flow select and switch to the good-performance underlying paths to ensure their quality of service(QoS) and reduce user's MPLS cost.
